values.name: customer
values.description: The customer changed or cancelled the order.

values.name: fraud
values.description: The order was fraudulent.

values.name: inventory
values.description: Items in the order were not in inventory.

values.name: declined
values.description: The payment was declined.

values.name: other
values.description: The order was cancelled for a reason not in the list above.

values.name: fixed_amount
values.description: Applies a discount of amount as a unit of the store's currency.

values.name: percentage
values.description: Applies a percentage discount of amount.

values.name: shipping
values.description: Applies a free shipping discount on orders that have a shipping rate less than or equal to amount.

values.name: pending
values.description: The finances are pending.

values.name: authorized
values.description: The finances have been authorized.

values.name: partially_paid
values.description: The finances have been partially paid.

values.name: paid
values.description: The finances have been paid.

values.name: partially_refunded
values.description: The finances have been partially refunded.

values.name: refunded
values.description: The finances have been refunded.

values.name: voided
values.description: The finances have been voided.

values.name: fulfilled
values.description: Every line item in the order has been fulfilled.

values.name: null
values.description: None of the line items in the order have been fulfilled.

values.name: partial
values.description: At least one line item in the order has been fulfilled.

values.name: bypass
values.description: Default. Do not claim inventory.

values.name: decrement_ignoring_policy
values.description: Ignore the product's inventory policy and claim amounts no matter what.

values.name: decrement_obeying_policy
values.description: Obey the product's inventory policy.

values.name: authorization
values.description: Money that the customer has agreed to pay. Authorization period lasts for up to 7 to 30 days (depending on your payment service) while a store awaits for a customer's capture.

values.name: capture
values.description: Transfer of money that was reserved during the authorization of a shop.

values.name: sale
values.description: The combination of authorization and capture, performed in one single step.

values.name: void
values.description: The cancellation of a pending authorization or capture.

values.name: refund
values.description: The partial or full return of the captured money to the customer.

enums.name: price_rule_allocation_method
enums.description: The allocation method of the price rule. With an allocation method of each, the discount will be applied to each of the entitled items. For example, for a price rule that take $15 off, each entitled line item in a checkout will be discounted by $15. With an allocation method of across, the calculated discount amount will be applied across the entitled items. For example, for a price rule that takes $15 off, the discount will be applied across all the entitled items. Currently, if target_type is shipping_line, then only each is accepted.

enums.name: price_rule_customer_selection
enums.description: The customer selection for the price rule. A customer selection of all means there are no restrictions on who's eligible for the price rule. A customer selection of prerequisite means a customer needs to belong to one of the specified prerequisite customer saved searches in prerequisite_saved_search_ids.

enums.name: price_rule_target_selection
enums.description: The target selection method of the price rule. Use all to apply the discount to all line items in the checkout and use entitled to apply to selected entitlements.

enums.name: price_rule_target_type
enums.description: The target type the price rule applies to.

enums.name: price_rule_value_type
enums.description: The value type of the price rule. If target_type is shipping_line then only percentage is accepted.

enums.name: shopify_customer_state
enums.description: The state of the customer's account with a shop.

enums.name: shopify_discount_pagination_direction
enums.description: Valid parameters for the 'direction' attribute when querying Shopify discounts. Using any other value yields a 500 response code from Shopify.

models.name: discount
models.description: See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/discount

fields.name: value
fields.description: optional for free shipping discount types

fields.name: applies_once
fields.description: When a discount applies to a product or collection resource, applies_once determines whether the discount should be applied once per order, or to every applicable item in the cart.

fields.name: value
fields.description: String - at flow, we serialize a `localized_variant` json object here.

models.name: price_rule
models.description: Price rules are a set of conditions, including entitlements and prerequisites, that must be met in order for a discount code to apply.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the discount.

fields.name: value_type
fields.description: The value type of the price rule, which can either be a fixed amount or a percentage. If `target_type` is 'shipping_line', then only 'percentage' is accepted. (Also - that percentage can only be 100%).

fields.name: target_type
fields.description: Specifies the resource to which the price rule is applied, which will either be a line item or a shipping line.

fields.name: value
fields.description: If target type is 'shipping line', then only a value of -100 is accepted. Values must start with a negative sign (-).

fields.name: starts_at
fields.description: The date when the discount code becomes valid for use during checkout.

fields.name: ends_at
fields.description: The date when the discount code becomes disabled.

fields.name: prerequisite_subtotal_range
fields.description: Prerequisite cart subtotal range.

fields.name: prerequisite_shipping_range
fields.description: Prerequisite shipping cost range. Can only be used when target type is 'shipping_line'. For example, one use case would be to offer free shipping if it's less than or equal to some value.

fields.name: usage_limit
fields.description: The maximum number of times the price rule can be used per discount code. Leave blank for unlimited uses.

fields.name: entitled_product_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable product ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_variant_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable product variant ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_collection_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable collection ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_country_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable country ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'. It is important to note that the id for a given country in one shop will not be the same as the id for the same country in another shop.

fields.name: allocation_method
fields.description: The allocation method of the price rule. With an allocation method of 'each', the discount will be applied to each of the entitled items. With an allocation method of 'across', the calculated discount amount will be applied across the entitled items.

fields.name: once_per_customer
fields.description: Determines whether the price rule can be used only once per customer (by customer id).

fields.name: target_selection
fields.description: The target selection method of the rule, which is either 'all' or 'entitled'.

fields.name: customer_selection
fields.description: The customer selection method of the price rule, which is either 'all' or 'selected'.

fields.name: prerequisite_saved_search_ids
fields.description: A list of prerequisite customer saved search ids. For the price rule to apply, the customer applying the price rule must be in the group of customers matching the customer saved searches. Requires `customer_selection` to be 'selected'.

fields.name: prerequisite_customer_ids
fields.description: A list of customer IDs.

fields.name: prerequisite_quantity_range
fields.description: The minimum number of items for the price rule to be applicable.

fields.name: prerequisite_product_ids
fields.description: List of product ids that will be a prerequisites for a Buy X Get Y type discount.

fields.name: prerequisite_variant_ids
fields.description: List of variant ids that will be a prerequisites for a Buy X Get Y type discount.

fields.name: prerequisite_collection_ids
fields.description: List of collection ids that will be a prerequisites for a Buy X Get Y discount.

fields.name: prerequisite_to_entitlement_quantity_ratio
fields.description: Buy/Get ratio for a Buy X Get Y discount.

fields.name: allocation_limit
fields.description: The number of times the discount can be allocated on the cart - if eligible.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the price rule, which may differ from its associated discount code(s), although it is recommended to be the same.

models.name: price_rule_greater_than_range
models.description: Represents either a greater than or greater than or equal to condition, where the latter takes precedence over the former.

models.name: price_rule_less_than_range
models.description: Represents either a less than or less than or equal to condition, where the latter takes precedence over the former. If less_than_or_equal_to == 100 (or null), and less_than == 20, Shopify combines them into less_than_or_equal_to == 20.

models.name: price_rule_prerequisite_to_entitlement_quantity_ratio
models.description: Represents either a greater than or greater than or equal to condition, where the latter takes precedence over the former.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Comma separated list of tags.

fields.name: inventory_item_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the inventory item, which is used in the Inventory API to query for inventory information.

fields.name: metafields
fields.description: Optional list of metafields that can be returned from products/updated webhooks

fields.name: orders
fields.description: An array of shopify_order

models.description: https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/gift_card

models.name: response_shopify_gift_cards
models.description: https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/gift_card

models.name: shop

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the shop.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The name of the shop.

fields.name: myshopify_domain
fields.description: The shop's 'myshopify.com' domain.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The shop's domain.

fields.name: primary_locale
fields.description: The shop's primary locale.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The three-letter code for the currency that the shop accepts.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: The two-letter country code corresponding to the shop's country.

models.name: shop_response
models.description: Shop response object from Shopify. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/shop

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The street address of the billing address.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: An optional additional field for the street address of the billing address.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city of the billing address.

fields.name: company
fields.description: The company of the person associated with the billing address.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country of the billing address.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code. Case insensitive. See https://api.flow.io/reference/countries

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The first name of the person associated with the payment method.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The last name of the person associated with the payment method.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the billing address.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the billing address.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the person associated with the payment method.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number at the billing address.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The name of the state or province of the billing add`ress.

fields.name: province_code
fields.description: The two-letter abbreviation of the state or province of the billing address.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip or postal code of the billing address.

fields.name: browser_height
fields.description: The browser screen height in pixels, if available.

fields.name: browser_ip
fields.description: The browser IP address.

fields.name: browser_width
fields.description: he browser screen width in pixels, if available.

fields.name: session_hash
fields.description: A hash of the session.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: A list of the ten most recently updated addresses for the customer.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the customer record was created.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tags are additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching, formatted as a string of comma-separated values.

fields.name: tax_exempt
fields.description: Whether the customer is exempt from paying taxes on their order.

fields.name: verified_email
fields.description: Whether the customer has verified their email address.

fields.name: accepts_marketing
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the customer would like to receive email updates from the shop.

fields.name: default_address
fields.description: The default address for the customer.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The customer's first name.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The customer's last name.

fields.name: last_order_id
fields.description: The ID of the customer's last order.

fields.name: last_order_name
fields.description: The name of the customer's last order.

fields.name: note
fields.description: Extra information about the customer.

fields.name: orders_count
fields.description: The number of orders placed by this customer to a shop. Pulls the current information.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The unique phone number (E.164 format) for this customer.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the customer record was last updated.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of the discount. The type field determines the unit of this amount.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The discount code.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of discount.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the location that the fulfillment should be processed for.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the fulfillment was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the fulfillment.

fields.name: line_items
fields.description: A historical record of each item in the fulfillment.

fields.name: order_id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the order.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description: A textfield with information about the receipt.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the fulfillment.

fields.name: tracking_company
fields.description: The name of the shipping company.

fields.name: tracking_number
fields.description: The shipping number, provided by the shipping company.

fields.name: tracking_numbers
fields.description: The shipping numbers, provided by the shipping company.

fields.name: tracking_url
fields.description: The URL to track the fulfillment.

fields.name: tracking_urls
fields.description: The URLs to track the fulfillment.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the fulfillment was last modified.

fields.name: notify_customer
fields.description: States whether or not the customer should be notified.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the gift card.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The balance of the gift card.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency of the gift card.

fields.name: initial_value
fields.description: If the value is much larger than the maximum, 'Inf' will be returned.

fields.name: last_characters
fields.description: The last four characters of the gift card code. Because gift cards are alternate payment methods, the full code cannot be retrieved.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the gift card was created.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the gift card was last modified.

fields.name: api_client_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the application that issued the gift card (if it was issued by an application).

fields.name: code
fields.description: A manually-created code; if not provided, one is generated.

fields.name: disabled_at
fields.description: The date and time when the gift card was disabled.

fields.name: expires_on
fields.description: The date and time when the gift card expires. The format must be YYYY-MM-DD.

fields.name: line_item_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the line_item that caused the creation of this gift card (if it was created by an order).

fields.name: note
fields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the gift card. Not visible to merchants (typo? I think they mean customers).

fields.name: order_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the order that caused the creation of this gift card (if it was created by an order).

fields.name: template_suffix
fields.description: When specified, the gift card will be rendered using gift_card.SUFFIX.liquid instead of gift_card.liquid.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the user that issued the gift card (if it was issued by a user).

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the adjustment.

fields.name: gift_card_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the gift card

fields.name: number
fields.description: A numeric sequence number for this adjustment with respect to the gift card.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: A number (signed) representing the value of the adjustment.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the adjustment was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format.

fields.name: processed_at
fields.description: The date and time when the adjustment was imported, in ISO 8601 format. This value can be set to dates in the past when importing from other systems. If no value is provided, it will be auto-generated.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The text of an optional note that can be attached to the adjustment. This value is not visible to customers.

fields.name: remote_transaction_ref
fields.description: The text of an optional reference note that can be attached to the adjustment. This value is not visible to customers.

fields.name: remote_transaction_url
fields.description: An optional reference URL that can be attached to the adjustment. This value is not visible to customers.

fields.name: api_client_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the application that issued the adjustment (if it was issued by an application).

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the user that issued the adjustment (if it was issued by a user).

fields.name: order_transaction_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the order transaction that issued the adjustment (if it was caused by an application of a gift card to an order).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: A number (signed) representing the value of the adjustment.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The text of an optional note that can be attached to the adjustment. This value is not visible to customers.

fields.name: order_transaction_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier of the order transaction that issued the adjustment (if it was caused by an application of a gift card to an order).

fields.name: processed_at
fields.description: Record a gift card adjustment as if it happened in the past.

models.name: shopify_location
models.description: A location represents a geographical location where your stores, pop-up stores, headquarters, and warehouses exist.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether the location is active. If true, then the location can be used to sell products, stock inventory, and fulfill orders.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city the location is in.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country the location is in.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: The two-letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format) corresponding to country the location is in.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID for the location.

fields.name: legacy
fields.description: Whether this is a fulfillment service location.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the location.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number of the location.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The province the location is in.

fields.name: province_code
fields.description: The two-letter code corresponding to province or state the location is in.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip or postal code.

fields.name: billing_address
fields.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method. This address is an optional field that will not be available on orders that do not require one.

fields.name: browser_ip
fields.description: The IP address of the browser used by the customer when placing the order.

fields.name: buyer_accepts_marketing
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the person who placed the order would like to receive email updates from the shop. This is set when checking the "I want to receive occasional emails about new products, promotions and other news" checkbox during checkout.

fields.name: cancel_reason
fields.description: The reason why the order was cancelled.

fields.name: cancelled_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was cancelled.

fields.name: cart_token
fields.description: Unique identifier for a particular cart that is attached to a particular order.

fields.name: client_details
fields.description: An object containing information about the client.

fields.name: closed_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was closed.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: This auto-generated property is the date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO 4217 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: customer
fields.description: An object containing information about the customer.

fields.name: discount_codes
fields.description: Applicable discount codes that can be applied to the order. If no codes exist the value will default to blank.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address. Is required when a billing address is present.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used for API purposes. This is different from the order_number property (see below), which is also a unique numeric identifier for the order, but used by the shop owner and customer.

fields.name: landing_site
fields.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

fields.name: line_items
fields.description: A list of line item objects, each one containing information about an item in the order.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: Only present on orders processed at point of sale. The unique numeric identifier for the physical location at which the order was processed.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The customer's order name as represented by a number.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the order.

fields.name: note_attributes
fields.description: Extra information that is added to the order. Each array entry must contain a hash with "name" and "value" keys as shown above.

fields.name: number
fields.description: Numerical identifier for an order unique to the shop. A number is usually sequential and starts at 1.

fields.name: order_number
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used by the shop owner and customer. This is different from the id property, which is also a unique numeric identifier for the order, but used for API purposes.

fields.name: payment_gateway_names
fields.description: The list of all payment gateways used for the order.

fields.name: processed_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was imported.

fields.name: processing_method
fields.description: States the type of payment processing method.

fields.name: referring_site
fields.description: The website that the customer clicked on to come to the shop.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: The list of refunds applied to the order.

fields.name: shipping_address
fields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

fields.name: shipping_lines
fields.description: An array of shipping_line objects, each of which details the shipping methods used.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: Where the order originated. May only be set during creation, and is not writeable thereafter.

fields.name: subtotal_price
fields.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tags are additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching, formatted as a string of comma-separated values.

fields.name: tax_lines
fields.description: An array of tax_line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.

fields.name: taxes_included
fields.description: States whether or not taxes are included in the order subtotal.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique identifier for a particular order.

fields.name: total_discounts
fields.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

fields.name: total_line_items_price
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order.

fields.name: total_price
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes and discounts included (must be positive).

fields.name: total_tax
fields.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order (must be positive).

fields.name: total_weight
fields.description: The sum of all the weights of the line items in the order, in grams.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was last modified.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Only present on orders processed at point of sale. The unique numerical identifier for the user logged into the terminal at the time the order was processed at.

fields.name: order_status_url
fields.description: The URL pointing to the order status web page. The URL will be null unless the order was created from a checkout.

fields.name: inventory_behaviour
fields.description: Determines which inventory updating behaviour is used.

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The payment gateway used.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The list of transactions to be created for the order.  Recommendation is to create transactions through the Transactions API, but a use case to create inline transactions may be for gift card payment transactions which are available at order creation.

fields.name: send_receipt
fields.description: Determines whether an order confirmation will be sent to the customer.

fields.name: metafields
fields.description: Metafields associated to the order

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The customer's first name.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The customer's last name.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Optional phone number for the customer.

fields.name: order
fields.description: Shopify order

fields.name: avs_result_code
fields.description: The Response code from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Address_Verification_System.  The code is a single letter; see http://www.emsecommerce.net/avs_cvv2_response_codes.htm for the codes and their definitions.

fields.name: credit_card_bin
fields.description: The issuer identification number (IIN), formerly known as bank identification number (BIN) ] of the customer's credit card. This is made up of the first few digits of the credit card number.

fields.name: credit_card_company
fields.description: The name of the company who issued the customer's credit card.

fields.name: credit_card_number
fields.description: The customer's credit card number, with most of the leading digits redacted with Xs.

fields.name: cvv_result_code
fields.description: The Response code from the credit card company indicating whether the customer entered the card security code, a.k.a. card verification value, correctly. The code is a single letter or empty string

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the refund.

fields.name: order_id
fields.description: The id of the related order.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the refund was created.

fields.name: processed_at
fields.description: The date and time when the refund was imported.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The optional note attached to a refund.

fields.name: refund_line_items
fields.description: Details about one returned/refunded item.

fields.name: restock
fields.description: Whether or not the line items were added back to the store inventory.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The list of transactions involved in the refund.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the user who performed the refund.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The optional note attached to a refund.

fields.name: discrepancy_reason
fields.description: The optional note attached to a refund.

fields.name: refund_line_items
fields.description: Details about one returned/refunded item.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The list of transactions involved in the refund.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) for the currency used for the payment.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the refund line item.

fields.name: line_item
fields.description: The single line item being returned.

fields.name: line_item_id
fields.description: The id of the related line item.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the associated line item that was returned.

fields.name: restock_type
fields.description: How this refund line item affects inventory levels.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The ID of the location where the items should be restocked. Required when restock_type has the value return or cancel.

fields.name: line_item_id
fields.description: The id of the related line item.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the associated line item that was returned.

fields.name: restock_type
fields.description: How this refund line item affects inventory levels.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The ID of the location where the items should be restocked. This is required when the value of restock_type is return or cancel.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A reference to the shipping method.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price of this shipping method.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source of the shipping method.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the shipping method.

fields.name: tax_lines
fields.description: A list of tax_line objects, each of which details the taxes applicable to this shipping_line.

fields.name: carrier_identifier
fields.description: A reference to the carrier service that provided the rate. Present if the rate was computed by a third party carrier service; null otherwise.

fields.name: requested_fulfillment_service_id
fields.description: A reference to the fulfillment service that is being requested for the shipping method. Present if shipping method requires processing by a third party fulfillment service; null otherwise.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The amount of tax to be charged.

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The rate of tax to be applied.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the tax.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the transaction.

fields.name: order_id
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of money that the transaction was for.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of transaction

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The name of the gateway the transaction was issued through. List of gateways at https://www.shopify.com/payment-gateways

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO 4217 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the transaction.

fields.name: payment_details
fields.description: An object containing information about the credit card used for this transaction.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description: A transaction receipt attached to the transaction by the gateway. The value of this field will vary depending on which gateway the shop is using.

fields.name: authorization
fields.description: The authorization code associated with the transaction.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the transaction was created.

fields.name: device_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the device.

fields.name: gift_card_id
fields.description: The gift card id associated with the transaction.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The origin of the transaction. This is set by Shopify and cannot be overridden.

fields.name: error_code
fields.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

fields.name: test
fields.description: The option to use the transaction for testing purposes.

fields.name: parent_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the parent.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the user.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of money that the transaction was for.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) for the currency used for the payment.

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The name of the gateway the transaction was issued through.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of transaction.

fields.name: parent_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the parent.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description: A transaction receipt attached to the transaction by the gateway. The value of this field will vary depending on which gateway the shop is using.

models.name: shopify_webhook_customers_redact
models.description: GDPR requirement to redact customer information

models.name: shopify_webhook_customers_redact_customer
models.description: GDPR requirement to redact customer information

models.name: shopify_webhook_order
models.description: Minimum shopify representation of an order so we can consume webhooks without the overhead

models.name: shopify_webhook_order_cancelled
models.description: Minimum shopify representation of an order so we can consume webhooks without the overhead

models.name: shopify_webhook_shop_redact
models.description: GDPR requirement to redact shop information within 48 hours after a shop uninstalls your app

models.name: webhook
models.description: Webhook response object from Shopify. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/webhook

fields.name: address
fields.description: The URI where the webhook should send the POST request when the event occurs.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format in which the webhook should send the data. Valid values are json and xml.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the webhook.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The event that will trigger the webhook.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook was updated. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: An array of fields which should be included in webhooks.

fields.name: metafield_namespaces
fields.description: An array of namespaces for metafields that should be included in webhooks.

models.name: webhook_form
models.description: Create a Shopify webhook. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/webhook#create

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The event that will trigger the webhook.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The URI where the webhook should send the POST request when the event occurs.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format in which the webhook should send the data. Valid values are json and xml.

fields.name: metafield_namespaces
fields.description: Optional array of namespaces for any metafields that should be included the webhook subscription.

models.name: webhook_form_wrapper
models.description: Create a Shopify webhook. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/webhook#create

models.name: webhook_response_list
models.description: Wrapper to list all Shopify webhooks. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/webhook#index

models.name: webhook_response_single
models.description: Wrapper for a Shopify webhook. See https://help.shopify.com/api/reference/webhook#index

parameters.name: last_id
parameters.description: Must be specified with the exact same value as the last_value parameter, if specified.

parameters.name: last_value
parameters.description: Must be specified with the exact same value as the last_id parameter, if specified.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Text filter for price rule titles.

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show price rules last updated after date (format 2017-03-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show price rules last updated before date (format 2017-03-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: last_id
parameters.description: Must be specified with the last processed gift card id, if specified.

parameters.name: last_value
parameters.description: Must be specified with the created_at parameter, if specified.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Either 'created_at', 'disabled_at', 'updated_at' following by ' asc' or ' desc' (note the space between).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of order ids

parameters.name: restock
parameters.description: Whether or not the line items were added back to the store inventory.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Send an email to the customer notifying them of the cancellation.
